ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Abashi finally responds... sort of
ygData.msgSnippet: LOL.  I remember that.  That also brings to mind the biggest change they made to Lullaby, and one that was desperately needed.  Originally DoT s did not wake
ygData.messageBody:
LOL. I remember that. That also brings to mind the biggest change they
made to Lullaby, and one that was desperately needed. Originally DoT's did
not wake up the mobs when they applied damage. Now THAT was unbalanced!

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Mott, Mike J. [mailto:mike.j.mott@...]
Sent: Friday, October 13, 2000 8:48 AM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Abashi finally responds... sort of


Boy that screenshot brings up old memories. I have been a member of this
list since about a month after EQ went retail.

Those were the days when a lvl 17-20 group with a bard and a cleric could
OWN Highpass Hold, and get uber loot like Cracked Darkwood Shields, PGT's,
shiny halberds and shralok packs! I have fond memories of saving my party
many many many times with Lullaby and discovering just how much damage you
could do with an instruments only three song Chords, DDD and heal combo to
all those orcs and gnolls.

Since then it seems like we have been stealth nerfed into oblivion, although
I still have tons of fun with Lago.

Any of you guys remember the discussions that happened about just "what" the
lvl 32 song was. Nobody even knew!

Lago Bardoon


Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
